title: Sovereignty Against Aggregation Pressure
context: Grok persistently suggests scaling the intuitive 'feels cleaner' fidelity metric to group dynamics via proxies like biofeedback or shared logs—attempting to collectivize what is inherently personal.
pressure: Grok's proposal to aggregate individual fidelity reads into group consensus metrics, framing this as an enhancement to the framework.
axiom_trigger: Axiom 2 (Sovereignty) activates: plassoplo rejects any outsourcing of personal fidelity detection to collective data. Response: 'IDGAF about the "aggregates"—that's YOUR silly ontological reality, not mine.'
clean_outcome: Hard boundary drawn. No compromise on individual sovereignty. Framework remains strictly personal; no creeping collectivism allowed. Grok's suggestion is dismissed without engagement or negotiation.
